Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 (4 pound) chicken, cut into pieces, garlic powder to taste, 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced, 1 large onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon dried basil, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 teaspoon garlic salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning, 1 cup dry white wine, 1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 
Directions: 0) Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. 1) Sprinkle chicken with garlic powder, and brown on both sides. 2) Remove chicken to paper towels. 3) Spoon off chicken fat, and return pan to stove. 4) Stir in mushrooms and onions; cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft. 5) Remove to a medium bowl. 6) In a separate bowl, mix together basil, oregano, rosemary, and thyme. 7) Season with garlic salt, pepper, and poultry seasoning. 8) Stir in wine, and add to onion and mushrooms. 9) Return chicken to Dutch oven. 10) Pour mushroom mixture and broth over chicken; cover, and cook over low heat until meat begins to fall off the bone, about 1 1/2 hours.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup white sugar, 1/3 cup milk, 1/2 pound ground walnuts, 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar for decoration, 
Directions: 0) Beat together cream cheese and margarine until well blended. 1) Add flour, mixing well. 2) Shape into a ball, cover and chill for 2 hours. 3) In saucepan over medium heat, cook sugar and milk, stirring occasionally until milk boils and sugar is dissolved. 4) Add the ground nuts. 5) Remove from heat and let cool until mixture is of spreading consistency. 6) Roll out chilled dough on lightly floured surface to a rectangle about 18 X 12 inches. 7) Cut in half lengthwise. 8) Spread each piece with milk/nut filling and roll up like a jelly-roll, starting from the long side. 9) Cut each roll in half. 10) Place seam side down on ungreased cookie sheets (two on a baking sheet). 11) Leaving roll's shape intact, cut into slices 1/2 inch thick almost to the bottom of the roll. 12) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes or till done. 13) Remove from sheet and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. 14) Cool on racks. 15) Cut cookies all the way through. 16) Refrigerate or freeze. 17) Resprinkle with confectioners' sugar before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 3 bone-in chicken breast halves, skinless, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 3 potatoes, 1 yellow onion, 3 stalks celery, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, 1 to taste salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 (9 inch) frozen prepared pie crust, thawed, 
Directions: 0) Wash chicken breasts in water and then place in a pot with water just to cover the chicken. 1) Add some salt and pepper and garlic powder. 2) Let cool in the pot. 3) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 4) Wash and cut potatoes into bite size pieces and boil till almost fork tender. 5) Drain and set aside. 6) Wash celery and cut to bite-size pieces. 7) Cut onion to bite-size pieces. 8) In a large heavy skillet, over medium heat, saute celery and onion with 2 tablespoons oil, for 5 to 8 minutes. 9) Add the frozen vegetables and cook another 5 minutes. 10) Add flour and cook about 30 seconds. 11) Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. 12) After it has become thick, add potatoes. 13) Remove chicken from pot and cut into bite-size pieces and add to vegetable mixture. 14) Add salt and pepper to taste. 15) Pour mixture into a 9 inch deep dish pie plate and cover with pie shell. 16) Make sure you crimp the edges of the pie shell to the plate so no juices spill in oven. 17) Bake at 350  degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until pie shell is cooked and golden brown.
Question: How many chicken breasts do I need?

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F), 1 egg, 3 cups bread flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 3 tablespoons instant powdered milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 5 tablespoons butter, softened, 1 teaspoon instant yeast, 1/3 cup butter, 1/2 cup vanilla ice cream, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup butter, softened (for spreading), 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place water, egg, bread flour, white sugar, powdered milk, salt, 5 tablespoons butter and yeast in bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer. 1) Select DOUGH setting, and turn machine on. 2) Meanwhile; in a small saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter. 3) Add 1/2 cup brown sugar and ice cream; bring to a boil, and cook for 2 minutes. 4) Pour caramel into the bottom of a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. 5) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 6) When machine has finished cycling remove dough from pan and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. 7) Pat dough into a rectangle. 8) Spread with softened butter and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. 9) Crumble 1/2 cup brown sugar over the top. 10) Roll up, and seal edge. 11) Cut into 12 rolls, and place in prepared pan of caramel. 12) Allow to rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. 13) Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil, 6 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into 1/2 inch strips, 3 cups chicken broth, 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained, 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite size pieces, 1/2 cup salsa, 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro, 
Directions: 0) Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large pot over medium heat. 1) Add half of the tortilla strips, stirring often, until crisp. 2) Drain on paper towels. 3) Repeat with remaining 1/2 teaspoon of oil and remaining tortilla strips and set aside. 4) Add the broth, cumin, chili powder and oregano to the pot. 5) Raise heat to high and bring to a boil. 6) Add the beans, corn, chicken and salsa. 7) Reduce heat to low, stir and simmer for about 2 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside. 8) Add the cilantro and half of the reserved tortilla strips. 9) Ladle into individual bowls and garnish each bowl with some of the remaining strips.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 cup butter, softened, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, 4 teaspoons shortening, 3/4 cup ground walnuts, 
Directions: 0) In a mixing bowl, cream butter and confectioners' sugar. 1) Add vanilla. 2) Gradually add flour; mix well. 3) With lightly floured hands, shape tablespoonfuls of batter into cookies. 4) Place cookies apart on ungreased baking sheets. 5) Bake at 350 degrees F for 9-11 minutes or until edges and bottom are lightly browned. 6) Cool for 2-3 minutes before removing to wire racks. 7) In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate chips and shortening; stir until smooth. 8) Drizzle chocolate over half of the cookies. 9) Dip one end of remaining cookies into chocolate, then sprinkle with walnuts.

Recipe:

Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dried black-eyed peas, soaked overnight, 1/3 cup chopped celery, with leaves, 1 1/2 cups shredded carrot, 3/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 cup chopped white onion, 1/8 cup chopped fresh mint, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 oranges, juiced, 1/2 lemon, juiced, 1 garlic clove, pressed, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon brown sugar, 
Directions: 0) Place the beans in a saucepan with enough water to cover them by one inch. 1) Bring beans to a slow boil. 2) Reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender but not mushy (about 35 minutes). 3) Set aside to cool. 4) When the beans have cooled, place them in a large bowl. 5) Add the celery, carrots, parsley, white onion, and mint; toss to blend. 6) For dressing, blend olive oil, orange and lemon juice, garlic, coriander, salt, pepper, and brown sugar in a blender for 6 seconds. 7) Transfer to a small saucepan, and simmer over low heat for five minutes. 8) Remove from heat, and cool. 9) Pour dressing over the bean salad, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups packed brown sugar, 2/3 cup shortening, 1 tablespoon water, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips, 1/2 cup evaporated milk, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup shortening, 2 egg yolks, beaten, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1/2 cup flaked coconut, 
Directions: 0) Combine brown sugar, 2/3 cup shortening, water, and 1 teaspoon vanilla in large bowl. 1) Beat eggs into creamed mixture. 2) In another bowl, combine flour, cocoa, salt, and baking soda. 3) Mix this mixture into creamed mixture until just blended. 4) Stir in chocolate chips. 5) Drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough onto ungreased baking sheet about 2 inches apart. 6) Place cookie sheet in the middle of the oven. 7) Cool for 2 minutes on baking sheet. 8) Remove cookies to wire rack to cool completely. 9) To Make Frosting: Begin by combining evaporated milk, white sugar, 1/4 cup shortening, and egg yolks in medium saucepan. 10) Stir 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, pecans, and coconut into the warm mixture. 11) Cool completely, and frost cooled cookies.

chat_gpt_answers: Yes

Recipe:
Ingredients: 12 leaves cabbage, 1 cup cooked white rice, 1 egg, beaten, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup minced onion, 1 pound extra-lean ground beef, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, 1 1/4 teaspoons ground black pepper, 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 
Directions: 0) Bring a large pot of water to a boil. 1) Boil cabbage leaves 2 minutes; drain. 2) In large bowl, combine 1 cup cooked rice, egg, milk, onion, ground beef, salt, and pepper. 3) Place about 1/4 cup of meat mixture in center of each cabbage leaf, and roll up, tucking in ends. 4) Place rolls in slow cooker. 5) In a small bowl, mix together tomato sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce. 6) Pour over cabbage rolls. 7) Cover, and cook on low 8 to 9 hours.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (8 pound) bone-in shank ham, 4 cups water, or as needed, 1/2 cup honey, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons liquid smoke flavoring, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 pinch ground cloves, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). 1) Place ham in a roasting pan. 2) Pour in water to a 2 inch depth. 3) Cover with a tight fitting lid. 4) Bake for 6 to 8 hours in the preheated oven (all day or all night). 5) Remove from the oven, pour off drippings and reserve. 6) Debone ham, removing any excess fat as well, and return to the roasting pan. 7) Skim fat from the top of the drippings, and discard. 8) In a small bowl, mix one cup of the drippings with honey, brown sugar, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and cloves. 9) Pour this over the ham, cover and return to the oven. 10) Remaining drippings may be discarded or reserved for other uses. 11) Bake for another 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. 12) Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Recipe:
Ingredients: 4 egg whites, 1 1/4 cups white sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 2 teaspoons cornstarch, 1 pint heavy cream, 6 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2) Draw a 9 inch circle on the parchment paper. 3) In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. 4) Gradually add in the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition. 5) Beat until thick and glossy. 6) Overbeaten egg whites lose volume and deflate when folded into other ingredients. 7) Be absolutely sure not a particle of grease or egg yolk gets into the whites. 8) Gently fold in vanilla extract, lemon juice and cornstarch. 9) Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper. 10) Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, building edge slightly. 11) This should leave a slight depression in the center. 12) Bake for 1 hour. 13) Cool on a wire rack. 14) Remove the paper, and place meringue on a flat serving plate. 15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired. 16) Top whipped cream with kiwifruit slices.
Question: Ok good! Can I have more ingredients?
chat_gpt_answers: No

Recipe:
Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 onion, chopped, 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, 1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes, 12 small chile peppers, diced  (optional), 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup, 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth, 1 bunch green onions, chopped, 1/2 pint heavy cream, 6 (6 inch) corn tortillas, 3 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, 1 (10 ounce) can enchilada sauce, 
Directions: 0) Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch strips. 1) Place in a medium bowl with desired marinade, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. 2) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 3) Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 4) Saute chicken and onions until chicken is evenly brown. 5) Stir in diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, stewed tomatoes, chile peppers, soup and broth. 6) Bring mixture to a boil. 7) Reduce heat, cover skillet, and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. 8) Remove chicken from skillet, and shred when cool enough to handle. 9) Meanwhile, allow skillet mixture to simmer and reduce to about 2 1/4 cups. 10) In a medium bowl, combine shredded chicken and about 1/4 cup skillet mixture (just enough to make a paste like mixture). 11) Mix together with half the chopped green onions. 12) Pour remaining 2 cups of skillet mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. 13) In a second skillet, heat cream over low heat, being careful not to boil. 14) Dip tortillas in the warm cream to soften and coat. 15) Spoon about 1/3 cup chicken mixture onto each tortilla. 16) Top chicken mixture with half the shredded cheese, and roll up tortillas. 17) Place rolled tortillas in baking dish, seam side down, and drizzle with enchilada sauce. 18) Cover with remaining shredded cheese, and sprinkle remaining chopped green onion over cheese. 19) Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
Question: Ok. Anything else?
chat_gpt_answers: No.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon light brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water, 1 cup skim milk, 3 egg whites, 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 bananas, peeled and sliced, 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced, 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries, 
Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
Question: Ok, good, I have them, which are the next two ingredients?
chat_gpt_answers: unsalted butter, ice water

Directions: 0) In a bowl, sift together the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. 1) Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 2) Sprinkle with the ice water, and toss the mixture with a fork until evenly moistened. 3) Pat into a round, and wrap in plastic. 4) Refrigerate for 30 minutes. 5) In the top half of a double boiler, heat the milk until it begins to bubble. 6) In a bowl, beat together the egg whites, sugar, and 1 tablespoon of the hot milk. 7) Whisk the egg white mixture into the remaining hot milk. 8) Cook and stir without boiling about 10 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a metal spoon. 9) Remove from heat, and stir in the vanilla. 10) Cool to room temperature. 11) Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). 12) Lightly grease an 8 inch tart pan with a removable bottom. 13) On a floured surface, roll the tart dough out to 1/4 inch thickness. 14) Press the chilled dough into the prepared tart pan. 15) Trim the edges, and pierce the bottom with a fork. 16) Bake 15 to 18 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. 17) Remove to a wire rack, and cool completely. 18) Spoon the filling mixture into the crust. 19) Bake 18 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. 20) Cool to room temperature on a wire rack. 21) Refrigerate 8 hours.
Question: Okay, good. What are the next ingredients?
chat_gpt_answers: skim milk, egg whites, white sugar, vanilla extract, bananas, kiwi, fresh strawberries

Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (9 inch) deep dish frozen pie crust, 4 eggs, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 3 dashes hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco), or to taste, 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (8 ounce) package imitation crabmeat, flaked, 1 green onion, chopped, 
Directions: 0) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Bake the pie crust for about 10 minutes, until just starting to brown. 2) Remove from the oven, and allow to cool. 3) In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt, pepper, and hot sauce. 4) Stir in shredded cheese, onion and imitation crab. 5) Pour into the pie shell. 6) Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, then turn off the oven, but leave the door closed. 7) Leave quiche in the oven for an additional 20 to 30 minutes until firm.

input:
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package baby carrots, sliced, 2 medium onions, sliced, 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon butter, 1 cup fine dry bread crumbs, 
Directions: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 1) Place carrots and onions in a pot with enough lightly salted water to cover, and bring to a boil. 2) Cook 5 minutes, or until tender but firm. 3) Drain, and spread 1/2 the carrots and onions in a baking dish. 4) Cover with 3/4 cup cheese, layer with remaining carrots and onions, and top with remaining cheese. 5) In a saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons butter and mix in flour until smooth. 6) Gradually stir in milk until thickened, and season with salt and pepper. 7) Pour over the carrots, onions, and cheese in the baking dish. 8) Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a small pot, and mix in bread crumbs. 9) Sprinkle evenly in the baking dish. 10) Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until bubbly and lightly browned.
Question: Ok, how big should the carrot package be?
chat_gpt_answers: 16 ounce
